Package gw.processes

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BatchProcess
    Interface for a BatchProcess that can be managed by a BatchProcessManager. A BatchProcess can expect to be launched in a newly-created thread, and will generally be provided with a callback that should be called upon completion.
    BatchProcessBase
    This class represents a base class for customer written batch processes. Other artifacts that need to be created along with this implementation A new BatchProcessType.xml entry for this batch process after making this change be sure to execute ant scheduler-config-xsd Your {@link gw.plugin.processing.IProcessesPlugin#createBatchProcess} must have an entry for this. Implementation notes: You must implement a constructor You may want either an argumentless constructor or one that takes an array of objects that can be passed by IMaintenanceAPI You must implement doWork. This does not yet have a transaction. If you need a transaction (and bundle) use {@link gw.transaction.Transaction#runWithNewBundle} This should check TerminateRequested and exit if set This should use incrementOperationsCompleted() and incrementOperationsFailed() You probably want to implement checkInitialConditions, to set OperationsExpected If you accept arguments you may want to override Exclusive, so multiple of this batch process can be run. If you are going to ignore TerminateRequested, override terminate() to return false
    ProcessHistoryPurge
    PurgeClusterMembers
    PurgeDeletableFiles

    TerminatedException  
    WorkItemSetPurge
    WorkQueueBase<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem>
    This class in the base class for all customer work queues. This object will be instantated once on each server that is processing the configured WorkQueue. A subclass must implement processWorkItem. This will be called whenever a WorkItem for this queue is to be processed. It maybe called on any server that this WorkQueue has been configured for. It is run within a transaction. Until a subclass implements findWorkItems, the batch process will do no work. If W is not StandardWorkItem, you must also implement createWorkItem before the batch process will work successfully. Example: package gw.test uses gw.processes.WorkQueueBase class TestWorkQueue1 extends WorkQueueBase{ static function newWorkItem(bean : TestGraphRoot, bundle : Bundle) : StandardWorkItem { return newStandardWorkItem(bean, "TestGosuWorkQueue", bundle) } construct() { super("TestGosuWorkQueue", StandardWorkItem, TestGraphRoot) } override function processWorkItem(workItem : StandardWorkItem) { Transaction.runWithNewBundle(\ bundle -> { workItem = bundle.add(workItem) var target = extractTarget(workItem) ... }, "su") } override function createWorkItem(bean : TestGraphRoot, bundle : Bundle) : StandardWorkItem { return newWorkItem(bean, bundle) } override function findTargets() : Iterator { return find(tgr in TestGraphRoot) } }
    WorkQueueInstrumentation  
    WorkQueueInstrumentationFieldType  
    WorkQueueInstrumentationPurge
